text: Geothermal vapor at Yangmingshan. Geothermal energy in Taiwan is estimated to have a generation potential of up to 30,000 MW.http://www.thinkgeoenergy.com/drilling-started-for-sanxing-geothermal- project-in-taiwan/ ==History== Taiwan started the exploration of geothermal wells since 1976 by CPC Corporation. Since then, there have been 34 wells drilled.https://www.formosanbs.com/news_info.asp?id=26http://www.thinkgeoenergy.com/taiwanese- oil-firm-cpc-to-explore-geothermal-project-at-mt-datun-near-taipei/ ==Geology== There are estimated several areas with highest potential for geothermal energy cultivation, which are Huadong Valley, Mount Lu, Tatun Volcano Group and Yilan Plain.https://www.formosanbs.com/news_info.asp?id=26 ==Power generation== Beinan Township, Taitung County. Taiwan established its first geothermal power plant in 1981. However, the plant was shut down in 1993 due to low efficiency.http://www.thinkgeoenergy.com/taiwanese-oil-firm-cpc-to- explore-geothermal-project-at-mt-datun-near-taipei/ ==See also== * Renewable energy in Taiwan ==References== Category:Geothermal energy Category:Renewable energy in Taiwan
title: Geothermal energy in Taiwan
